result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus E Cotton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus E Cotton in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Marcus E Cotton.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court rescheduled plea hearing upon request from the defense.  Parties notified of new date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 2:00 pm. This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Marcus E Cotton not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea date. Court set matter as requested.  State to file an order to produce.  Defendant has a pending felony before Branch 16. Branch 40 authorizes/accepts transfer for possible global resolution. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Marcus E Cotton not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus E Cotton in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask; both appear by video.  Defendant Marcus E Cotton in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 20CF2592. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Bayside Officer D. Bunting.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus E Cotton not in court, defendant in custody.   Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus E Cotton not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD needs more info to determine if the defenant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Marcus E Cotton in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Marcus E Cotton in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marcus E Cotton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
